cards.name: Pacifism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack or block.
cards.flavor: For the first time in his life, Grakk felt a little warm and fuzzy inside.
cards.originalText: Enchanted creature cannot attack or block.

cards.name: Pearl Dragon
cards.text:
Flying
{1}{W}: Pearl Dragon gets +0/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"They knew Bantau was lost when, to hide the pearl he had found on the beach, he swallowed it—and soon grew wings."
—Hakim, Loreweaver
cards.originalText:
Flying
{1}{W}: +0/+1 until end of turn

cards.name: Prismatic Circle
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
As Prismatic Circle enters the battlefield, choose a color.
{1}: The next time a source of your choice of the chosen color would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Rashida Scalebane
cards.text: {T}: Destroy target attacking or blocking Dragon. It can't be regenerated. You gain life equal to its power.
cards.flavor: It is not by the blood of dragons that Rashida measures victories, but by the sum of children who no longer wake from nightmares of scales and fire.
cards.originalText: {T}: Bury target attacking or blocking Dragon. Gain an amount of life equal to that Dragon's power.

cards.name: Ritual of Steel
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Ritual of Steel enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
cards.flavor:
"Our soldiers are blessed with lizard scales as hard and cold as steel."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText:
Draw a card at the beginning of the upkeep of the turn after Ritual of Steel comes into play.
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.

cards.name: Sacred Mesa
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Sacred Mesa unless you sacrifice a Pegasus.
{1}{W}: Create a 1/1 white Pegasus creature token with flying.
cards.flavor:
"Do not go there, do not go / unless you rise on wings, unless you walk on hooves."
—"Song to the Sun," Femeref song

rulings.text: It can be used during upkeep to create a Pegasus token in time for it to be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
During your upkeep, sacrifice a Pegasus or bury Sacred Mesa.
{1}{W}: Put a Wild Pegasus token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 white creature with flying that counts as a Pegasus.

cards.name: Shadowbane
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you and/or creatures you control this turn, prevent that damage. If damage from a black source is prevented this way, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor: Light creates shadow; light destroys shadow. Such is the transience of darkness.

rulings.text: This only prevents damage the chosen source would deal to you or a creature you control. If the creature would deal damage to another player, a planeswalker, or a creature you don't control, it does not get prevented.

cards.originalText: Prevent all damage to you or a creature you control from any one source. If that source is black, gain 1 life for each 1 damage prevented in this way.

cards.name: Sidar Jabari
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
Whenever Sidar Jabari attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.
cards.flavor:
"Prophecy is whatever one makes of it, but destiny cannot be changed."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
If Sidar Jabari attacks, tap target creature defending player controls.

cards.name: Soul Echo
cards.text:
Soul Echo enters the battlefield with X echo counters on it.
You don't lose the game for having 0 or less life.
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Soul Echo if there are no echo counters on it. Otherwise, target opponent may choose that for each 1 damage that would be dealt to you until your next upkeep, you remove an echo counter from Soul Echo instead.

rulings.text: If you have more than one Soul Echo, the opponent chooses which ones will be replacing damage that turn (if any). And when damage happens, you decide which one of the ones the opponent selected that you want the damage to be replaced with, but the damage all goes to one of them.
If this card runs out of counters before your next upkeep, the effect still replaces the damage and uselessly tries to remove counters from the now empty card.
In a multi-player game, you choose a new opponent during each of your upkeeps.
If you take damage between the start of the upkeep step and the time in which the upkeep trigger resolves, then Soul Echo will not affect that damage and you will be affected by the damage as normal.

cards.originalText:
When you play Soul Echo, put X echo counters on it. 
At the beginning of your upkeep, if there are no echo counters on Soul Echo, bury it; otherwise, target opponent may choose that for each 1 damage dealt to you until your next upkeep, you instead remove 1 echo counter from Soul Echo.
You do not lose the game as a result of having less than 1 life.

cards.name: Spectral Guardian
cards.text: As long as Spectral Guardian is untapped, noncreature artifacts have shroud. (They can't be the targets of spells or abilities.)
cards.flavor:
"A treasure to guard other treasures is worth the highest price."
—Mtai, Civic Guildmage
cards.originalText: As long as Spectral Guardian is untapped, noncreature artifacts cannot be the target of spells or effects.

cards.name: Sunweb
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
Sunweb can't block creatures with power 2 or less.
cards.flavor:
"There is no sweeter music than the wails of a dying dragon."
—Rashida Scalebane
cards.originalText:
Flying
Sunweb cannot block creatures with power 2 or less.

cards.name: Teremko Griffin
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"When we're aloft, I love to lean over the Weatherlight's railing and watch the patterns the griffins' shadows make on the clouds below."
—Sisay, Captain of the Weatherlight

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a "band." The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers' damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.originalText: Banding, flying

cards.name: Unyaro Griffin
cards.text:
Flying
Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red instant or sorcery spell.
cards.flavor: The griffin's shadow gives courage to the righteous and dread to the idle.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Sacrifice Unyaro Griffin: Counter target red spell that assigns damage to you or a creature you control. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Vigilant Martyr
cards.text:
Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Regenerate target creature.
{W}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Counter target spell that targets an enchantment.
cards.originalText:
Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Regenerate target creature. 
{W}{W}, {T}, Sacrifice Vigilant Martyr: Counter target spell that targets an enchantment in play. Play this ability as an interrupt.

cards.name: Wall of Resistance
cards.text:
Defender (This creature can't attack.)
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if Wall of Resistance was dealt damage this turn, put a +0/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Telim'Tor could no longer recall the exact number of assaults—but his troops could.

rulings.text: It gets only one counter a turn, not one per point of damage.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of any turn in which Wall of Resistance is dealt damage, put a +0/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Ward of Lights
cards.text:
You may cast Ward of Lights as though it had flash. If you cast it any time a sorcery couldn't have been cast, the controller of the permanent it becomes sacrifices it at the beginning of the next cleanup step.
Enchant creature
As Ward of Lights enters the battlefield, choose a color.
Enchanted creature has protection from the chosen color. This effect doesn't remove Ward of Lights.

rulings.text: The sacrifice occurs only if you cast it using its own ability. If you cast it using some other effect (for instance, if it gained flash from Vedalken Orrery), then it won't be sacrificed.

cards.originalText:
You may choose to play Ward of Lights as an instant; if you do, bury it at end of turn.
Enchanted creature gains protection from a color of your choice. The protection granted by Ward of Lights does not bury Ward of Lights.

cards.name: Yare
cards.text: Target creature defending player controls gets +3/+0 until end of turn. That creature can block up to two additional creatures this turn.
cards.originalText: Target creature defending player controls gets +3/+0 until end of turn. That creature may be assigned to block up to three creatures this turn. All blocks must be legal.

cards.name: Zhalfirin Commander
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}{W}: Target Knight creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Command is the act of balancing on a vine and convincing others that it is firm ground."
—Sidar Jabari
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{1}{W}{W}: Target Knight gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Zhalfirin Knight
cards.text:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking blocks this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}{W}: Zhalfirin Knight gains first strike until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"You returned a warrior. . . . Your hair was cut, your eye tattooed with the red triangle of war."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText:
Flanking (Whenever a creature without flanking is assigned to block this creature, the blocking creature gets -1/-1 until end of turn.)
{W}{W}: First strike until end of turn

cards.name: Zuberi, Golden Feather
cards.text:
Flying
Other Griffin creatures get +1/+1.
cards.flavor:
"If the griffins tell of their gods, perhaps they speak of feathers bright as the Sun."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText:
Flying
Zuberi, Golden Feather counts as a Griffin. 
All other Griffins get +1/+1.

cards.name: Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, put a +1/+1 counter on Asmira, Holy Avenger for each creature put into your graveyard from the battlefield this turn.
cards.flavor:
"Omens lie in this early harvest's fruit."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger

rulings.text: The ability counts creatures that went to the graveyard before this card entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of each turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Asmira, Holy Avenger for each creature put into your graveyard from play that turn.

cards.name: Benthic Djinn
cards.text:
Islandwalk (This creature can't be blocked as long as defending player controls an Island.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, you lose 2 life.
cards.flavor:
"In all my years I've only met one mage who successfully trapped a djinn—and none who tried and failed."
—Talibah, embermage
cards.originalText:
Islandwalk (If defending player controls any islands, this creature is unblockable.)
During your upkeep, lose 2 life.

cards.name: Cadaverous Bloom
cards.text: Exile a card from your hand: Add {B}{B} or {G}{G}.
cards.flavor:
"It's filthy work, planting them."
—Kifimbo, Shadow Guildmage
cards.originalText: Choose a card in your hand and remove it from the game: Add {B}{B} or {G}{G} to your mana pool. Play this ability as a mana source.

cards.name: Circle of Despair
cards.text: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to any target this turn, prevent that damage.
cards.flavor:
"Life is a resource that should belong only to the strong."
—Shauku, Endbringer
cards.originalText: {1}, Sacrifice a creature: Prevent all damage to any creature or player from any one source.

cards.name: Delirium
cards.text:
Cast this spell only during an opponent's turn.
Tap target creature that player controls. That creature deals damage equal to its power to the player. Prevent all combat damage that would be dealt to and dealt by the creature this turn.

rulings.text: Tapping the creature is part of the effect and not the cost, therefore you can cast this targeting a tapped creature.

cards.originalText:
Play only on target opponent's turn.
Tap target creature that player controls. That creature deals to the player an amount of damage equal to its power. The creature neither deals nor receives combat damage this turn.

cards.name: Discordant Spirit
cards.text:
At the beginning of each end step, if it's an opponent's turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Discordant Spirit for each 1 damage dealt to you this turn.
At the beginning of your end step, remove all +1/+1 counters from Discordant Spirit.

rulings.text: This will not count damage that was prevented.
In Two-Headed Giant, triggers only once per end of turn, not once for each player.

cards.originalText:
At end of target opponent's turn, put a +1/+1 counter on Discordant Spirit for each 1 damage dealt to you this turn.
At end of your turn, remove all these counters from Discordant Spirit.

cards.name: Emberwilde Caliph
cards.text:
Flying, trample
Emberwilde Caliph attacks each combat if able.
Whenever Emberwilde Caliph deals damage, you lose that much life.
cards.flavor: The fire breathes while the air burns.
cards.originalText:
Flying, trample
Emberwilde Caliph attacks each turn if able.
For each 1 damage Emberwilde Caliph successfully deals, lose 1 life.

cards.name: Energy Bolt
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Energy Bolt deals X damage to target player or planeswalker.
• Target player gains X life.
cards.flavor: Life and death are two faces of the same coin.
cards.originalText: Energy Bolt deals X damage to target player, or target player gains X life.

cards.name: Frenetic Efreet
cards.text:
Flying
{0}: Flip a coin. If you win the flip, Frenetic Efreet phases out. If you lose the flip, sacrifice Frenetic Efreet. (While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist. It phases in before you untap during your next untap step.)
cards.originalText:
Flying
{0}: Flip a coin; target opponent calls heads or tails while coin is in the air. If the flip ends up in your favor, Frenetic Efreet phases out. Otherwise, bury Frenetic Efreet.

cards.name: Grim Feast
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Grim Feast deals 1 damage to you.
Whenever a creature is put into an opponent's graveyard from the battlefield, you gain life equal to its toughness.
cards.flavor: "Hmmm—midnight snack."

rulings.text: It affects all opposing players in a multiplayer game.

cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, Grim Feast deals 1 damage to you.
Whenever a creature is put into target opponent's graveyard from play, gain an amount of life equal to that creature's toughness.

cards.name: Harbor Guardian
cards.text:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
Whenever Harbor Guardian attacks, defending player may draw a card.
cards.flavor:
"Our guardian levies a tax on all traders. Wise travelers pay with a minimum of fuss."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat
cards.originalText:
Harbor Guardian can block creatures with flying.
If Harbor Guardian attacks, defending player may draw a card.

cards.name: Haunting Apparition
cards.text:
Flying
As Haunting Apparition enters the battlefield, choose an opponent.
Haunting Apparition's power is equal to 1 plus the number of green creature cards in the chosen player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: Like some foul herdbeast, it grazes on the dead.

rulings.text: You choose one opposing player when it enters the battlefield and it only affects that one player. This choice is not changed even if this card changes controllers. This card becomes useless but stays on the battlefield if the chosen player leaves the game.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Haunting Apparition has power equal to 1 plus the number of green creature cards in target opponent's graveyard.

cards.name: Hazerider Drake
cards.text: Flying, protection from red
cards.flavor:
"The hazerider danced in the thunderstorm and sang to its music."
—Afari, Tales
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from red

cards.name: Jungle Troll
cards.text:
{R}: Regenerate Jungle Troll.
{G}: Regenerate Jungle Troll.
cards.flavor:
"You eat plants; I eat plants. You eat beasts; I eat you."
—Drulvurg, troll king
cards.originalText:
{R}: Regenerate
{G}: Regenerate

cards.name: Kaervek's Purge
cards.text: Destroy target creature with converted mana cost X. If that creature dies this way, Kaervek's Purge deals damage equal to the creature's power to the creature's controller.
cards.originalText: Destroy target creature with casting cost equal to X. If that creature is put into the graveyard in this way, Kaervek's Purge deals to the creature's controller an amount of damage equal to the creature's power.

cards.name: Leering Gargoyle
cards.text:
Flying
{T}: Leering Gargoyle gets -2/+2 and loses flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Only a gargoyle would take such delight in a thunderstorm."
—Qhattib, Vizier of Amiqat
cards.originalText:
Flying
{T}: Leering Gargoyle gets -2/+2 and loses flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Malignant Growth
cards.text:
Cumulative upkeep {1} (At the beginning of your upkeep, put an age counter on this permanent, then sacrifice it unless you pay its upkeep cost for each age counter on it.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, put a growth counter on Malignant Growth.
At the beginning of each opponent's draw step, that player draws an additional card for each growth counter on Malignant Growth, then Malignant Growth deals damage to the player equal to the number of cards they drew this way.

rulings.text: In multiplayer games it affects all opponents.
The triggered ability is put onto the stack after you have already drawn your card for the turn.

cards.name: Phyrexian Purge
cards.text:
This spell costs 3 life more to cast for each target.
Destroy any number of target creatures.
cards.flavor: Only those who have nothing have nothing to fear.

rulings.text: The life payment is an additional cost, paid at the time you cast Phyrexian Purge. You don't get any life back if the spell is countered, or if one or more targets have become illegal.

cards.originalText: Pay 3 life per target: Destroy any number of target creatures.

cards.name: Prismatic Boon
cards.text: Choose a color. X target creatures gain protection from the chosen color until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"How ironic that the greatest forge of civilization is battle."
—Mangara
cards.originalText: X target creatures gain protection from a single color of your choice until end of turn.

cards.name: Purgatory
cards.text:
Whenever a nontoken creature is put into your graveyard from the battlefield, exile that card.
At the beginning of your upkeep, you may pay {4} and 2 life. If you do, return a card exiled with Purgatory to the battlefield.

rulings.text: If an opponent takes control of this card and pays for the upkeep ability, the creatures will enter the battlefield under their control even if you exiled them.
If destroyed at the same time some creatures are destroyed, the destroyed creatures are exiled and stay exiled.

This has been restored to a triggered ability that triggers when a nontoken creature is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, rather than a replacement effect. The creature does go to the graveyard, and will trigger any other abilities that look for this event.

If this card changes controllers between putting the upkeep triggered ability on the stack and resolving it, the creature is put onto the battlefield under the control of the player who controlled this card when the ability was put on the stack.

cards.originalText:
Whenever a summon card is put into your graveyard from play, put that card face up under Purgatory.
During your upkeep, you may pay {4} and 2 life to put any card under Purgatory into play as though it were just played.
If Purgatory leaves play, remove all cards under if from the game.

cards.name: Radiant Essence
cards.text: Radiant Essence gets +1/+2 as long as an opponent controls a black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Her beauty was the beauty of the Sun at midday, deadly to those who underestimated her strength."
—Azeworai, "Kenechi's Dream"

rulings.text: In a multiplayer game, it gets the bonus if at least one opponent controls a black permanent.

cards.originalText: As long as target opponent controls any black permanents, Radiant Essence gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Reflect Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage this turn, that damage is dealt to that source's controller instead.
cards.flavor:
From you to me, so me to you.
—Femeref children's taunt
cards.originalText: Redirect all damage dealt by any one source to that source's controller.

cards.name: Reparations
cards.text: Whenever an opponent casts a spell that targets you or a creature you control, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Sorry I burned down your village. Here's some gold."
cards.originalText: Whenever target opponent successfully casts a spell that targets you or a creature you control, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Rock Basilisk
cards.text: Whenever Rock Basilisk blocks or becomes blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.
cards.flavor: In the eastern reaches of Jamuraa are arrangements of massive stones. No one knows their origins—for certain.
cards.originalText: Whenever Rock Basilisk blocks or is blocked by a non-Wall creature, destroy that creature at end of combat.

cards.name: Savage Twister
cards.text: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.
cards.flavor:
"Frozen, we watched the funnel pluck up three of the goats—pook! pook! pook!—before we ran for the wadi."
—Travelogue of Najat
cards.originalText: Savage Twister deals X damage to each creature.

cards.name: Sawback Manticore
cards.text:
{4}: Sawback Manticore gains flying until end of turn.
{1}: Sawback Manticore deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Activate this ability only if Sawback Manticore is attacking or blocking and only once each turn.
cards.originalText:
{4}: Flying until end of turn
{1}: Sawback Manticore deals 2 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Use this ability only once each turn and only if Sawback Manticore is attacking or blocking.

cards.name: Sealed Fate
cards.text: Look at the top X cards of target opponent's library. Exile one of those cards and put the rest back on top of that player's library in any order.
cards.flavor: It's good to know more about your enemy's fate than your enemy does.

rulings.text: The controller of this spell decides the order of the cards on the library.

cards.originalText: Look at the top X cards of target opponent's library. Remove one of those cards from the game and put the rest back on top of that player's library in any order.

cards.name: Shauku's Minion
cards.text: {B}{R}, {T}: Shauku's Minion deals 2 damage to target white creature.
cards.flavor:
"My minions serve me in the light; I serve no one."
—Shauku, Endbringer
cards.originalText: {B}{R}, {T}: Shauku's Minion deals 2 damage to target white creature.

cards.name: Spatial Binding
cards.text: Pay 1 life: Until your next upkeep, target permanent can't phase out.
cards.flavor:
Time is the one shackle you can't break.
—Zhalfirin aphorism

rulings.text: If used on an Aura and the permanent enchanted by that Aura phases out, the Aura will not phase out. It will stay on the battlefield and then immediately be put into the graveyard since the permanent it was enchanting is phased out.

cards.originalText: Pay 1 life: Target permanent cannot phase out until the beginning of your next upkeep.

cards.name: Unfulfilled Desires
cards.text: {1}, Pay 1 life: Draw a card, then discard a card.
cards.flavor:
"Like Day from Night, / I'll live my life apart from you, just glimpsing you across the sky, / because you cannot change, my dear, and nor can I."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: {1}, Pay 1 life: Draw a card, then choose and discard a card.

cards.name: Vitalizing Cascade
cards.text: You gain X plus 3 life.
cards.flavor:
"Water is like breathing—necessary for life."
—Asmira, Holy Avenger
cards.originalText: Gain X+3 life.

cards.name: Warping Wurm
cards.text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
At the beginning of your upkeep, Warping Wurm phases out unless you pay {2}{G}{U}.
When Warping Wurm phases in, put a +1/+1 counter on it.
cards.flavor: Even wurms start out small.
cards.originalText:
Phasing 
During your upkeep, pay {2}{G}{U} or Warping Wurm phases out. 
When Warping Wurm phases in, put a +1/+1 counter on it.

cards.name: Wellspring
cards.text:
Enchant land
When Wellspring enters the battlefield, gain control of enchanted land until end of turn.
At the beginning of your upkeep, untap enchanted land. You gain control of that land until end of turn.

rulings.text: If Wellspring leaves the battlefield, the control effect still lasts until end of turn.

cards.originalText:
When Wellspring comes into play, gain control of enchanted land. 
At the end of each of your turns, lose control of enchanted land. 
At the beginning of each of your turns, gain control of enchanted land.

cards.name: Windreaper Falcon
cards.text: Flying, protection from blue
cards.flavor:
Watching the windreaper
—Zhalfirin phrase meaning
"daydreaming"
cards.originalText: Flying, protection from blue

cards.name: Zebra Unicorn
cards.text: Whenever Zebra Unicorn deals damage, you gain that much life.
cards.flavor:
"I'll capture gentle zebras / for your steeds and fill the stable with every kind of unicorn."
—"Love Song of Night and Day"
cards.originalText: For each 1 damage Zebra Unicorn deals, gain 1 life.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Swamp
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Forest
cards.originalText: {T}: Add {G} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bad River
cards.text:
Bad River enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Bad River: Search your library for an Island or Swamp card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Bad River comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Bad River: Search your library for an island or swamp card. Put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Crystal Vein
cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add {C}{C}.
cards.originalText:
{T}: Add one colorless mana to your mana pool.
{T}, Sacrifice Crystal Vein: Add two colorless mana to your mana pool.

cards.name: Flood Plain
cards.text:
Flood Plain enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Flood Plain: Search your library for a Plains or Island card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Flood Plain comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Flood Plain: Search your library for a plains or island card. Put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Grasslands
cards.text:
Grasslands enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Grasslands: Search your library for a Forest or Plains card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a plains or forest card if you do not want to.

cards.originalText:
Grasslands comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Grasslands: Search your library for a forest or plains card. Put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Mountain Valley
cards.text:
Mountain Valley enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Mountain Valley: Search your library for a Mountain or Forest card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You do not have to find a mountain or forest card if you do not want to.

cards.originalText:
Mountain Valley comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Mountain Valley: Search your library for a mountain or forest card. Put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Rocky Tar Pit
cards.text:
Rocky Tar Pit enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Rocky Tar Pit: Search your library for a Swamp or Mountain card, put it onto the battlefield, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: Because the "search" requires you to find a card with certain characteristics, you don't have to find the card if you don't want to.

cards.originalText:
Rocky Tar Pit comes into play tapped.
{T}, Sacrifice Rocky Tar Pit: Search your library for a swamp or mountain card. Put that land into play. Shuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Teferi's Isle
cards.text:
Phasing (This phases in or out before you untap during each of your untap steps. While it's phased out, it's treated as though it doesn't exist.)
Teferi's Isle enters the battlefield tapped.
{T}: Add {U}{U}.
cards.flavor: The three wizards knew only that this isle held a great mystery—and that patience alone would solve it.
cards.originalText:
Phasing
Teferi's Isle comes into play tapped.
{T}: Add {U}{U} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Bull Elephant
cards.text: When Bull Elephant enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return two Forests you control to their owner's hand.
cards.flavor: Four gray trees and a long, coiling snake. What am I? —Zhalfirin riddle

cards.name: Dark Privilege
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1.
Sacrifice a creature: Regenerate enchanted creature.
cards.flavor:
"As you breathe your last, understand why I accept such forbidden gifts."
—Purraj of Urborg

cards.name: King Cheetah
cards.text: Flash
cards.flavor: If you find yourself and a friend being chased by a king cheetah, you have but one chance: Trip your friend. —Suq'Ata wisdom

rulings.text: King Cheetah is always a Creature spell, never an instant, regardless of when you cast it.

cards.name: Necrosavant
cards.text: {3}{B}{B}, Sacrifice a creature: Return Necrosavant from your graveyard to the battlefield. Activate this ability only during your upkeep.
cards.flavor:
"Ah, I remember my first death."
—Zarkuu, necrosavant

rulings.text: The ability is activated while this card is in the graveyard.

cards.name: Ovinomancer
cards.text:
When Ovinomancer enters the battlefield, sacrifice it unless you return three basic lands you control to their owner's hand.
{T}, Return Ovinomancer to its owner's hand: Destroy target creature. It can't be regenerated. That creature's controller creates a 0/1 green Sheep creature token.

rulings.text: Can target itself. This will cause it to be returned to your hand during announcement and will result in no sheep since it will not be on the battlefield at resolution so the effect fails since it target is illegal.

cards.name: Peace Talks
cards.text: This turn and next turn, creatures can't attack, and players and permanents can't be the targets of spells or activated abilities.
cards.flavor:
"By the tongues of a thousand serpents, this time I do not lie."
—Ahmahz il Kin, Suq'Ata diplomat

rulings.text: Can be cast after your attack.

It affects the current turn and the next turn. This could affect the same player twice if they have two turns in a row, or it could affect different players. In a multiplayer game it affects exactly two turns, not a full round of turns.
Doesn't skip the Combat Phase, just renders creatures unable to attack.
Activated abilities contain a colon. They're generally written "[Cost]: [Effect]." Some keywords are activated abilities and will have colons in their reminder text.

cards.name: Urborg Mindsucker
cards.text: {B}, Sacrifice Urborg Mindsucker: Target opponent discards a card at random. Activate this ability only any time you could cast a sorcery.
cards.flavor:
"My pet will pick the ripe fruit from your tortured brain as if it were hanging from a vine."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: If you cast this as normal during your main phase, it will enter the battlefield and you'll receive priority. If no abilities trigger because of this, you can activate its ability immediately, before any other player has a chance to remove it from the battlefield.

cards.name: Vampirism
cards.text:
Enchant creature
When Vampirism enters the battlefield, draw a card at the beginning of the next turn's upkeep.
Enchanted creature gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control.
Other creatures you control get -1/-1.

cards.name: Viashino Sandstalker
cards.text:
Haste (This creature can attack the turn it comes under your control.)
At the beginning of the end step, return Viashino Sandstalker to its owner's hand. (Return it only if it's on the battlefield.)
cards.flavor:
"Some believe sandstalkers to be illusions; those with scars know better."
—Zhalfirin Guide to the Desert

rulings.text: It is returned to its owner's hand at the end of any turn in which it is on the battlefield.

foreignNames.name: ヴィーアシーノの砂漠の狩人

cards.name: Wicked Reward
cards.text:
As an additional cost to cast Wicked Reward, sacrifice a creature.
Target creature gets +4/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The blood on my hands is merely proof of my ambition."
—Kaervek

rulings.text: You must sacrifice exactly one creature to cast this spell; you cannot cast it without sacrificing a creature, and you cannot sacrifice additional creatures.
Players can only respond once this spell has been cast and all its costs have been paid. No one can try to destroy the creature you sacrificed to prevent you from casting this spell.

cards.name: Soul Warden
cards.text: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.
cards.flavor: "One does not question the size or shape of the grains of sand in an hourglass. Nor do I question the temperament of the souls under my guidance."

rulings.text: Does not trigger on a card on the battlefield being changed into a creature.
The ability will not trigger on itself entering the battlefield, but it will trigger on any other creature that is put onto the battlefield at the same time.
Two Soul Wardens entering the battlefield at the same time will each cause the other's ability to trigger.
The life gain is mandatory.

cards.originalText: Whenever another creature enters the battlefield, you gain 1 life.

cards.name: Tidehollow Sculler
cards.text:
When Tidehollow Sculler enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals their hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger. This ability will do nothing when it resolves. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the chosen card forever.

cards.originalText:
When Tidehollow Sculler enters the battlefield, target opponent reveals his or her hand and you choose a nonland card from it. Exile that card.
When Tidehollow Sculler leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Path to Exile
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller may search their library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle their library.

rulings.text: If the targeted creature becomes an illegal target by the time Path to Exile would resolve, the entire spell doesn't resolve. The creature's controller won't search for a basic land card.
The controller of the exiled creature isn't required to search their library for a basic land. If that player doesn't, the player won't shuffle their library.

cards.originalText: Exile target creature. Its controller may search his or her library for a basic land card, put that card onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle his or her library.

cards.name: Inquisition of Kozilek
cards.text: Target player reveals their hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.
cards.flavor: You will scream out your innermost secrets just to make it stop.

rulings.text: If you target yourself with this spell, you must reveal your entire hand to the other players just as any other player would.

cards.originalText: Target player reveals his or her hand. You choose a nonland card from it with converted mana cost 3 or less. That player discards that card.

cards.name: Shrine of Loyal Legions
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a white spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Loyal Legions: Create a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token for each charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep or whenever you cast a white spell, put a charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.
{3}, {T}, Sacrifice Shrine of Loyal Legions: Put a 1/1 colorless Myr artifact creature token onto the battlefield for each charge counter on Shrine of Loyal Legions.

cards.name: Honor of the Pure
cards.text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
cards.originalText: White creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Intangible Virtue
cards.text: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.
cards.flavor: In life, they were a motley crew: farmers, lords, cutpurses, priests. In death, they are united in singular, benevolent purpose.
cards.originalText: Creature tokens you control get +1/+1 and have vigilance.

cards.name: Raise the Alarm
cards.text: Create two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens.
cards.flavor: "The nim raid our homes without warning. We must defend our homes without hesitation."
cards.originalText: Put two 1/1 white Soldier creature tokens onto the battlefield.
